intro: Conyza sumbavensis, commonly known as the African ironweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in dry to moist conditions. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution across the region.
